document_data.name: Thort's Findings
document_data.services: Miscellaneous artifacts, relics, and exotic goods
document_data.mainbody: '''Thort's Findings''' was a small curios shop in the city of [[Waterdeep]] that was housed within the detached head of [[the Swordmaiden]], one of the colossal [[Walking Statues of Waterdeep]].{{Cite dragon/430/The Harpers of Waterdeep|37-38}}
document_data.Locations: The shop stood in a city square between [[Hassantyr's Street]], [[Tarsar's Street]], [[Whaelgond Way]], and [[Ussilbran Street]].
document_data.Interior: The hollowed-out head of the Swordmaiden had multiple floors with tight staircases and landings. It also sported a number of hidden rooms.
document_data.Services: Thort's sold a variety of exotic goods, artifacts, relics, and oddities that had been brought in by [[adventurer]]s. Many of these came from [[dungeon]]s, such as the local [[Undermountain]]. These items were all displayed with little hand-written placards that either identified them or provided speculation as to their purpose and origin. Beyond merely selling items, Thort's was known to rent out its curios as decor to wealthy merchants and [[Nobility of Waterdeep|Waterdhavian nobles]] in search of props for their themed revels.
document_data.Activities: The hidden rooms within Thort's served as safe houses for agents of the [[Harpers]] or the organization's contacts.
document_data.Reputation: Thort's was regularly visited by all manner of [[alchemist]]s, sages, and [[wizard]]s in search of items that could prove useful.
document_data.History: Thort's Findings was established sometime after [[1385 DR]], the year in which the Walking Statues rampaged across the city as a result of the [[Spellplague]]. The shop was still in operation by [[1492 DR]].{{Waterdeep-time}}
document_data.Inhabitants: Thort's was owned, operated, and lived-in by the retired adventurer [[Undevver Thort]].
